pages.title: Bluespotted Trevally
pages.text: Caranx is a genus of tropical to subtropical marine fishes in the jack family Carangidae, commonly known as jacks, trevallies and kingfishes.$(br2)They are moderate- to large-sized, deep-bodied fishes which are distinguished from other carangid genera by specific gill raker, fin ray and dentition characteristics.

pages.title: Bluespotted Trevally
pages.text: Relative Size: ★★☆☆☆$(br2)Always active$(br2)1 Colors$(br2)Favourite Food: untamedwilds:chum$(br2)Number of Offspring: 4$(br2)Growth time: 6 Days
